intro: Lomaria attenuata var. pteropus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lomaria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, a characteristic common in the Apiaceae family. This variety is often found in moist, sandy soils along coastal regions.
